top_comments.comment: i am fine to hear from her prospective as well. It was well said. they should use their wealth to protect their environment. i hope they do
is there enough water to add green roofs? one could grow food there too? even cactus? some cactus produce very nice fruits

comments_since_last_sample.body: I lived in Kuwait, I survived the rule is not go out when its hot in afternoon,Nights are cooler or at least not 50c. Same as In North parts of Canada it get -50c in winter. We adapt and find ways to adjust. I don’t find this BBC report interesting 🧐
The world's weather goes in cycles. This eco-agenda is just pushing left-wing political thought.

Complaining about needing AC in Kuwait is like complaining about needing heaters in Canada. i’m not saying climate change isn’t an issue, I’m just saying your not gonna be playing with your kids in playgrounds at 48C either. Also, We have great weather from Nov - April. But yeah I get the point of this video and if there are measures to bring down the heat i’m all for it.
Plant some trees it will help
I was here in Kuwait 🇰🇼 for that heat.
48°C in Bahrain recently, hottest on record.
I survived there in 2003 without AC when i was on deployment. these people cry too much.
This video was less about how people live in 50°C, and more about the thoughts and daily life of a rich american influencer in a hot country.
I would rather be in a poor country with lovely weather and down to earth people then a very hot weather country with extreme temperature and arrogant people😎😎
The lady who planted tree is more practical than the lady living in AC.

Unfortunately  it's only the start up here in canada 🇨🇦 this sunner was unreal trees left with a lot dead needles from heat in b.c. it was 52 degrees in  parts I live at 4500 feet it was 42 degrees I can't imagine this coming summer 😫
Lived my whole life in Kuwait it aint that hot. I mean its true u feel ur being slow cooked but whats shocking u see ice cream seller with only an umbrella to givd him shadd

TO CONVERT CELSIUS TO FAHRENHEIT : MULTIPLY CELSIUS BY 1.8 THEN ADD 32 : 50 X 1.8 + 32 = 122 DEGREES FAHRENHEIT
